text:
Remy, your mom's
picking you up
after school, okay?

Frankie, are you coming home
before your volleyball game?

The nice people
who created us
are asking you a question.

No, Mom, Dio and I
are gonna hang out
before the game.

You and Dio have become
quite the thing lately.
Oh, he liked my new pic!

Frankie, if you don't
watch where you're going,

Man, it's tough being right
all the time.

for your little
mystery solving club
to solve, okay?

Wake up. This town has
so much strange going on.

And we're not a little club.
We're S.W.E.A.T.I.

Wow, rolls right
off the tongue.

It was between that and
the Preteens Official
Outsiders Paranormal Society.

Can't believe I'm saying,
this but S.W.E.A.T.I.
is better.

It's the lesser
of two stinkies.

We should have left
two minutes ago.

Someone wanna
give us a ride?

Layla, please tell me
you're over it.

Nope. Not over it.
Still mad.

What are you guys
fighting about?

Dude walks around here
like he owns the place.

He's a Snickering.
His great grandad
founded the town,

and built the school
and the factory.

And I think his cousin
owns the boba shop.

Just a reminder to support
the volleyball team tonight,
as our Snickering Spiders

take on the dreaded
Tucker Tasmanian Devils.

led by our fearless captain,
Frankie Ripp.

Of course.
Meet you for boba?

Dio, why don't you
boogie on down
to your own class, okay?

FRANKIE: Layla,
I'm over you
being not over it.

Winky face, winky face,
smiley face.

What just happened?
Where am I?

And why don't
I have any bars?

What is this place?
Why am I here?

What do you mean?
I didn't die.
I was about to drink Boba.

I don't know what that is.
I do know that you died,

and you're in
the Underworld now.

My name is Pretty,
and as soon

as I take care
of this nice man,
I'll be glad to help you.

This key will unlock
your eternal resting place.

Please take it over
to my colleague, Scary,

Why do you need my name?
I'm not checking in.

I will find your reservation
in a jiffy.

Hello, I'm Scary.
Please insert your key.

We don't make mistakes
in the Underworld.

But it is odd that I can't
find your reservation.

Which probably means I'm not
supposed to be here, right?
(CHUCKLES NERVOUSLY)

I need to speak
to a manager right now.

(IN ECHOING VOICE)
I am the Grim Reaper.

(IN NORMAL VOICE)
Hello, what's the problem,
sweetie?

Way to crush that
glass ceiling, girl!

(CHUCKLES) Look GR.
Can I call you GR?

Yeah, no, we don't
really make those.

Look, I shouldn't be here.
My life's just starting.

There's Dio.
We're kind of a thing.

We're supposed to be
having boba right now.

I have this huge
volleyball game tonight.

She's my forever bestie.
I mean, sure,
she's all upset...

Whoa. (CHUCKLES NERVOUSLY)
You middle named me.
as I was trying to tell you,

there has indeed been
a sort of a...

Let's agree to call it
a mishap, hmm? (CHUCKLES)

so just send me home,
and we can forget

I can't send you back
from the Underworld
without someone to guide you.

Uh, no, no.
I was thinking
Scary, you'd go.

Yeah, I'm not really
a people person.

I am! Me, over here!
I'll go!

Two is better than one.
You'll both go.

Now... (CHUCKLES NERVOUSLY)
I need you
to watch over Frankie,

I'll check in
from time to time,

the three of you
can help me
tie up some loose ends.

Are you talking about
your other mistake?

Frankie, darling, are you
ready to go home?
Unless you want to stay?

Wonderful. Just need you
to sign this little contract.

So, just put
your signature
right there.

Oh, it's just standard
contract lingo.

Anywho, I'll have a copy
sent to your home.

Don't let the flash of light
hit you on the way out.
(CHUCKLES)
There he is. Remy, my man!

Yeah, we could
hit the batting cages,

And then finish the day off
with a little
father-son mani-pedi.

Actually, I was just gonna
hang out with Carson today.
Is that okay?

Of course it is, buddy.
That's just fine.

It's just not the same
without our Frankie.

It's me, Mom.
It's Frankie.
I'm back.

How is it possible
you're here?

And what happened
to your hair?

Oh, okay.
I see you, side effect.

Frankie, we have
so many questions.

Where did you go,
after you...

Died, Mom.
You can say it.

Did you see
any bright lights?

Did your soul
leave your body?

Well, there were
some neon lights,

then I just
plopped into this place
called the Underworld.

And how did you get
out of this Underworld?

Oh, you know,
just had to play
some hard ball

with the Grim Reaper herself.
(CHUCKLES) No big.

The Grim Reaper
is a woman?

Anyway, GR goofed up
with my whole dying thing,

so to make it right,
she sent me home.

It's kind of
part of the deal.

Hello, strange people
in my house
I haven't met before.

No, Dad. Pretty's his name.
And this is Scary.

We're so glad
to have you back, Frankie.

The last two weeks
have been awful.

Two weeks? It was, like,
two minutes.

Oh, I've got
a million more questions
about this Underworld.

Is it like
a waiting room?
And do you guys work there?

Also, we never
closed the circle
on that pancake thing.

Sorry, he came
with the house.

Frankie, I'm just so glad
to have you home.

Come on, Scary,
get in on this.

Oh, that's
a new look for you.

Yeah, I wanted to try
something different.

I'm so excited to go
to school with you today.

Oh, I don't know
if you can go with me.

We probably need
to enroll you first.

Already done.
I called your principal,

and told her she can expect
two new foreign exchange
students today.

Way to think
on your feet, Mom.

Yay! We get to go
to school, Scary!
Yes, I am full of yay.

Oh, nothing on social
about me coming back.
Do you think people know?

And that's the photo
they used?

Also, we should have
left two minutes ago.

Someone wanna
give us a ride?

Not to brag,
but people are gonna be
really excited to see me.

Wow! They really are
excited to see you.

Wait, are you two
a thing now?

Well, when you fell
into that manhole,
I was super bummed.

And you weren't there
to comfort me.

Frankie, I'm sorry,
but you died.

Just reminding you
that we have
a big volleyball game tonight,

so come out
and support our Spiders,

led by
our captain, Layla Mueller.

It's weird, we've been in
a couple of classes together,

and this is the first time
we're talking.

(SCOFFS) It's not weird.
I only talk to people
that interest me.

So, I didn't
interest you before?

No, but congrats!
Now you do!

PRINCIPAL: (OVER PA)
I'd also like you to join me
in welcoming back to school,

Okay, settle, settle down.
Settle down! Every...

Now, as you can see,
we've got our Frankie back.

we all know stranger things
have happened here
in Snickering Willows.

Like, for instance,
this total snack
is still single.

Whoa. I'm just realizing
I had a funeral.

Thanks for getting me
out of PE.

Oh, and we also have
two new foreign exchange
students joining us.

So, everyone, let's give
a warm Willows welcome

More like
Pretty, Freak and Scary.

Really? Thanks, 'cause I tried
washing it out 1,000 times,
but it won't go away.

Where exactly
are you two from?

You have a restaurant
in the middle
of your school?

It's the cafeteria.
Grab a tray.

Look, I'm just gonna
put it out there.
This whole Dio and I thing,

I mean, maybe I was
still mad at you
about our fight.

All I'm saying is,
you can't just die

and expect that
to fix everything.

Hmm. Can we talk
about this later?

No, we can't.
Coach replaced you,
because...

Look! It's Pretty,
Freak and Scary.
It's a giant gust of wind.

In the middle
of the cafeteria?

She died. She's back.
She spilled food
on herself.

It felt like this energy
was running through me.

Someone left
the door open again.

Here you go. You got
a little something...

I can safely say worse things
have happened. (CHUCKLES)

You're gonna need
a bigger napkin.

Not only is Frankie back, son,
she is here to stay.

Okay, but I meant
back from school.

I'm just so happy
we're whole again.

(STRAINING)
But you gotta
let go of me.

MR. RIPP: Honey? Do you know
where I put my glasses?

And that's why
you're the king
of the S.W.E.A.T.I.s.

MRS. RIPP: Who was
at the door?

I mean,
just a package for Frankie.
I'll go put it in her room.

What kind of contract
is this?
And who am I talking to?

Ah! How was your
first day at school?

MRS. RIPP:
How about you, Frankie?

How was it,
seeing your friends again?

Oh, you got a package earlier.
Remy took it up to your room.

This feels like
a good chance

for us to spend
some quality time together.

REMY: It... It's not
what it looks like.

Or maybe it is.
What does it look like to you?

It looks like you
opened my package.

Yeah, okay, then it is
what it looks like.

But, Frankie,
there's something
I really need to tell you.

Okay, and pinkies out,
and now let's drink.

I hope you like
the tea.

And all over my nana's quilt.
(CHUCKLES)

So, what is it that you
both do in the Underworld?

I'm a Greeter.
That's how I met Frankie
when she died.
And what do you do, Scary?

I'm an Exit Usher.
I sit and read

in front of an elevator
where people
find out their fate.

Whoa! There's a whole lot
going on here.

Being here made me
feel close to you.

The three-eyed fish.
Sinkhole at the park?

Don't you see?
It's all connected.

And why are you investigating
the meat replacement factory?

Dad's worked
at Snickering's Finest
his whole life.

No one knows what
the meat replacement is.
That's not mysterious to you?

Huh. I guess it just blends in
with the rest of the weird
in Snickering Willows.

Yep, and it gets
weirder every day.

You know, like two strangers
from the Underworld
suddenly living with us?

Frankie, do you trust
Pretty and Scary?

But I promise I'll keep
an eye out, okay?

Good, because you didn't
keep an eye out
when you fell in a manhole.

So, Pretty, were you okay
sleeping in Remy's
top bunk last night?

It was great.
I only fell out twice.

And Scary,
was the air mattress
in Frankie's room

It's more comfortable
than my bed of nails
in the Underworld.

You have to admit,
it's strange the Grim Reaper
let you come back.

That's why I had to
see for myself
what was in that contract.

You could have just
asked me what was in there,
instead of taking it.

Why? I knew
you didn't read it.

But, yeah,
I didn't read it.

I don't think GR
wanted me to.

Yeah, because
she hid stuff in there

she didn't want you
to see.

Always read
before you sign, Frankie.

You're gonna make
a great nagging parent
one day.

Wait, have Pretty and Scary
been stuck talking to
our parents this whole time?

Okay, Scary, I'm sorry,
but I have to ask.

Can you tell me which people
from Snickering Willows
got the, uh, down arrow?

Scary, you do not
have to answer that.

FRANKIE: Pretty! Scary!
Can you come upstairs?

Sweetheart, we were actually
just in the middle of...

Guys, we need to talk about
the Grim Reaper's contract.

I read all of it,
and I found
something big!

that you have to finish
a series of tasks
for the Grim Reaper.

You had me all worried.
Tasks are easy.

tickets to Dua Lipa
or something.

Point is, we can handle
any tasks GR might have.

It also says that
if you can't finish all
of the Grim Reaper's tasks,

you have to return
to the Underworld forever!

No, but you seemed
super excited,

so I made it look like
I was trying harder.

You can't summon
the Grim Reaper, Frankie.

I told you,
she just appears.

Hello! How are my
three favorite peeps?
Did you miss me?

No, no, no, no, no, GR.
You can't just pop in

all Snow White style
and pretend
everything's okay.

You hid stuff from me.
What's up
with these tasks?

Yes, those were
clearly stated
in your contract.

You know, you should
always read something
before you sign it, my dear.

Just tell me what I
have to do to stay here,
because I'm staying.

Oh, we'll get there, sweetie.
All in due time.

(IN ECHOING VOICE)
See you real soon.

I'm just here
to grab my stuff and go.

We're gonna need
all the S.W.E.A.T.I.
help we can get.

Yep, I heard it
when I said it.
